title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of wealth, love, and tragedy in the Jazz Age, centered around the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the young wizard Harry Potter and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A profound novel exploring racial injustice and moral growth in the American South through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romance that critiques the social norms of 19th-century England, focusing on the spirited Elizabeth Bennet and her relationship with Mr. Darcy.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected journey filled with dragons, dwarves, and treasure in this beloved fantasy adventure.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt the great white whale, Moby Dick, explores themes of revenge and fate.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A teenage boy named Holden Caulfield recounts his struggles with identity and belonging in postwar America.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The epic first part of the trilogy where Frodo begins his quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A strong-willed governess, Jane Eyre, overcomes hardships and finds love with the mysterious Mr. Rochester.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella that satirizes totalitarian regimes through a story about farm animals revolting against their human farmer.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Four siblings discover a magical world inside a wardrobe, where they join the fight against the evil White Witch.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark and passionate tale of love and revenge between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A thrilling mystery that follows Robert Langdon as he uncovers secrets hidden in famous works of art.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd named Santiago embarks on a journey to find his personal legend and fulfill his dreams.
